main_definition: An adjective referring to someone or something that embodies purity, innocence, perfection or a state of being Christ-like in nature; also used as a given name.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to the essence of Christianity and its teachings
meanings_and_examples.example: His actions were truly christine, reflecting the compassionate nature of Jesus.
She had a natural, untouched beauty that seemed almost christine in its simplicity.
His performance was so impeccable and without error; it could only be described as a true christine act.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A name given to females, derived from the Greek word for Christ
meanings_and_examples.example: Christine is a popular name in many English-speaking countries, symbolizing purity and devotion.
